### Why
It is time to version control and share (with my different machines and whoever else wants to peek)!

### How I did set it up
I decided to follow the _detached worktree_ approach.
This means that I have somewhere a directory which is the git repository for my dotfiles.
This directory is *NOT* my HOME, there are no symlinks or installation script.

I have it at `$HOME/git/dotfiles.git`.
And I have an alias for git commands when I have to manage it, `home`, which stands for:
```
$ alias home
alias home='git --work-tree=/Users/espin --git-dir=/Users/espin/git/dotfiles.git'
```

So when I want to add a new dotfile in my $HOME, I issue:
```
$ home add .newdotfile
$ home commit -m "a new dotfile"
```

### How to replicate on another machine
see http://silas.sewell.org/blog/2009/03/08/profile-management-with-git-and-github/
